intro: Matelea quindecimlobata, commonly known as the fifteen-lobed matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other plants with showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves with fifteen lobes, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and numerous stamens, making it visually striking. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands.
